p: A decoction of P. arboreum has been used in the Brazilian traditional medicine against venereal diseases and infections of the urinary throat [ 199, 200] and to treat sexually transmitted diseases, bronchitis, urinary infections, rheumatic problems and as carminative [ 17, 201]. Moreover, P. arboreum is used in the folk medicine of northeast of Brazil as sedative and to counteract the effects of snake bite while the inflorescense of P. arboreum or a decoction of it leaves are used to prepare a remedy for treatment of hepatic pains [ 17].
